page.title: 18Living in Durris
page.content: We carried out a survey in the class to find out what pupils liked about Durris and what they didn't like.They said they enjoyed the fresh air,peace and quiet and the lack of traffic.They liked the landscape of farms and woods, which is good for exploring and watching wildlife.They were keen on the views,the sounds and the countryside smells.The disadvantages were,firstly,that there were no shops in our block.The one mentioned most was the chip shop.The lack of clubs for young people was also mentioned, and several pupils said they would like a park or play area nearby. It is the case that parents have to drive their children to get to any of these amenities,but the class thought that, on the whole,they would rather live here in Durris than in a town or city.
